summary:
Carnegie Mellon University (CMU) is a top research university in Pittsburgh, USA. Founded in 1900 by Andrew Carnegie, it started as a technical school and later became a university after merging with the Mellon Institute. CMU has a main campus in Pittsburgh and several other campuses worldwide.

The university is famous for its engineering, computer science, and business schools. It has a strong focus on research and has made many firsts in computer science and other fields. CMU also has a successful athletics program and has produced many notable alumni, including Nobel Prize winners.
title: Carnegie Mellon University
